description: A variant of earlier tetchy (“cranky, easily annoyed, difficult to handle”), under influence from some senses of touch (“affect, disturb”) and simulating touch +‎ -y.

entries.meaning: (of a situation) Extremely sensitive or volatile; easily disturbed to the point of becoming unstable; requiring caution or tactfulness.
examples: It is an extremely touchy situation, with everybody's patience wearing thin.
He can be very touchy when you talk about his cat, so be as tactful as possible.

entries.meaning: (informal) Inclined to engage in physical touch.
